intro: Mammillaria asterias, commonly known as the star cactus, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its compact, globular shape and a dense covering of white, woolly bristles. The plant typically grows to a height of 5–10 centimeters and features small, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. Its stems are ribbed and covered in areoles, which are specialized structures that bear spines and flowers. Mammillaria asterias is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water and well-draining soil to thrive.
